class ollama_forge.client.OllamaClient(base_url: str = DEFAULT_OLLAMA_API_URL, timeout: int = DEFAULT_TIMEOUT, max_retries: int = 3, session: requests.Session | None = None)[source]¬∂

Client for interacting with the Ollama API.

This class provides a comprehensive interface to all Ollama API endpoints, with support for both synchronous and asynchronous requests, streaming responses, and robust error handling.

base_url[source]¬∂

Base URL for the Ollama API

timeout[source]¬∂

Request timeout in seconds

max_retries[source]¬∂

Maximum number of retries for failed requests

Initialize the Ollama client.

Parameters:

  • base_url ‚Äì Base URL for the Ollama API

  • timeout ‚Äì Request timeout in seconds

  • max_retries ‚Äì Maximum number of retries for failed requests

  • session ‚Äì Optional requests.Session to use

max_retries = 3[source]¬∂

_thread_local[source]¬∂
_with_retry(method: str, endpoint: str, data: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, stream: bool = False, headers: Dict[str, str] | None = None) → requests.Response | None[source]¬∂

Make an HTTP request with retry logic.

Parameters:

  • method ‚Äì HTTP method (GET, POST, etc.)

  • endpoint ‚Äì API endpoint to call

  • data ‚Äì Request data

  • stream ‚Äì Whether to stream the response

  • headers ‚Äì Optional request headers

Returns:

Response object

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError ‚Äì If connection fails after all retries

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ModelNotFoundError ‚Äì If the model is not found

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ServerError ‚Äì If the server returns a 5xx error

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.InvalidRequestError ‚Äì If the request is invalid

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.TimeoutError ‚Äì If the request times out

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaAPIError ‚Äì For other API errors

get_version() → Dict[str, Any][source]¬∂

Get the Ollama server version.

Returns:

Dictionary with version information

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError ‚Äì If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaAPIError ‚Äì If the response is invalid

list_models() → Dict[str, List[Dict[str, Any]]][source]¬∂

List available models.

Returns:

Dictionary with models information

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError ‚Äì If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaAPIError ‚Äì If the response is invalid

pull_model(model: str, stream: bool = True) → Dict[str, Any] | Generator[Dict[str, Any], None, None][source]¬∂

Pull a model from the Ollama registry.

Parameters:

  • model ‚Äì Name of the model to pull

  • stream ‚Äì Whether to stream the progress

Returns:

If stream=True, a generator yielding progress updates If stream=False, a dictionary with pull result

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError ‚Äì If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.InvalidRequestError ‚Äì If the model name is invalid

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaAPIError ‚Äì If the response is invalid

generate(model: str, prompt: str, options: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, stream: bool = False) → Dict[str, Any] | Iterator[Dict[str, Any]][source]¬∂

Generate text from a prompt.

Parameters:

  • model ‚Äì Name of the model to use

  • prompt ‚Äì The prompt to generate from

  • options ‚Äì Dictionary of generation options

  • stream ‚Äì Whether to stream the response

Returns:

If stream=True, a generator yielding response chunks If stream=False, a dictionary with the complete response

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError ‚Äì If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ModelNotFoundError ‚Äì If the model does not exist

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.InvalidRequestError ‚Äì If the request is invalid

chat(model: str, messages: List[Dict[str, str]], options: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, stream: bool = False) → Dict[str, Any] | Iterator[Dict[str, Any]][source]¬∂

Chat with a model.

Parameters:

  • model ‚Äì Name of the model

  • messages ‚Äì List of message dictionaries (role, content)

  • options ‚Äì Chat options

  • stream ‚Äì Whether to stream the response

Returns:

If stream=True, a generator yielding response chunks If stream=False, a dictionary with the complete response

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError ‚Äì If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ModelNotFoundError ‚Äì If the model does not exist

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.InvalidRequestError ‚Äì If the messages format is invalid

  • prompts ‚Äì List of texts to create embeddings for

  • options ‚Äì Optional embedding parameters

  • show_progress ‚Äì Whether to show a progress bar

Returns:

List of embedding vectors

Raises:

model ‚Äì Name of the model to delete

  • destination ‚Äì Destination model name

Returns:

  • stream ‚Äì Whether to stream the creation progress

Returns:

Context manager for automatic model fallback.

Parameters:

  • prompt ‚Äì The user‚Äôs query or message

  • system_prompt ‚Äì Optional system prompt to use

Returns:

Context dictionary with parameters

Example

with client.fallback_context(‚Äúchat‚Äù):response = client.chat(model, messages)
